no journal? is ist ext3? if so that message sounds bad
it means it can't see a journal for the file system. that effectively means its ext2
you can't if the journal is lost
if the journal is lost your only option is to recreate the file system, loosing all data on the partition

ext3 is ext2 with a journal
so if only the journal is lost you could probably save your data
make sure it's unmounted then typ fsck.ext2 /dev/whatever
